verse.verse_0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
verse.verse_1: Noon. By the pen, and by what they inscribe.
verse.verse_2: By the grace of your Lord, you are not insane.
verse.verse_3: In fact, you will have a reward that will never end.
verse.verse_4: And you are of a great moral character.
verse.verse_5: You will see, and they will see.
verse.verse_6: Which of you is the afflicted.
verse.verse_7: Your Lord knows best who has strayed from His path, and He knows best the well-guided.
verse.verse_8: So do not obey the deniers.
verse.verse_9: They would like you to compromise, so they would compromise.
verse.verse_10: And do not obey any vile swearer.
verse.verse_14: Just because he has money and children.
verse.verse_15: When Our Verses are recited to him, he says, "Myths of the ancients!"
verse.verse_16: We will brand him on the muzzle.
verse.verse_17: We tested them, as We tested the owners of the garden, when they vowed to harvest it in the morning.
verse.verse_19: But a calamity from your Lord went around it while they slept.
verse.verse_20: And in the morning it was as if picked.
verse.verse_21: In the morning, they called to one another.
verse.verse_22: "Go early to your plantation, if you are going to harvest."
verse.verse_23: So off they went, murmuring to one another.
verse.verse_24: "No poor person is to enter it upon you today."
verse.verse_25: And early they went, resolved in intent.
verse.verse_26: But when they saw it, they said, "We were wrong.
verse.verse_28: The most reasonable of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'if only you would glorify?'"
verse.verse_29: They said, "Glory to our Lord-We were indeed in the wrong."
verse.verse_30: Then they turned to one another, blaming one another.
verse.verse_31: They said, "Woe to us-we were indeed domineering.
verse.verse_32: Perhaps our Lord will give us a better substitute for it. We are turning to our Lord."
verse.verse_33: Such is the punishment; but the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
verse.verse_34: For the righteous are Gardens of Delight with their Lord.
verse.verse_35: Shall We treat the Muslims like the villains?
verse.verse_36: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
verse.verse_37: Or do you have a scripture in which you study.
verse.verse_38: Wherein there is whatever you choose?
verse.verse_39: Or do you have oaths from Us, binding until the Day of Resurrection, that you will have whatever you demand?
verse.verse_40: Ask them, which of them will guarantee that.
verse.verse_41: Or do they have partners? Then let them produce their partners, if they are truthful.
verse.verse_42: On the Day when the Shin will be exposed, and they will be called to bow down, but they will be unable.
verse.verse_43: Their eyes subdued, shame will cover them. They were invited to bow down when they were sound.
verse.verse_44: So leave Me to those who reject this discourse; We will proceed against them gradually, from where they do not know.
verse.verse_45: And I will give them respite. My plan is firm.
verse.verse_46: Or do you ask them for a fee, so they are burdened with debt?
verse.verse_47: Or do they know the future, and so they write it down?
verse.verse_48: So wait patiently for the Decision of your Lord, and do not be like the Fellow of the Fish who cried out in despair.
verse.verse_49: Were it not for his Lord's favor that reached him, he would have been thrown into the wilderness, fully despised.
verse.verse_50: But his Lord chose him, and made him one of the righteous.
verse.verse_51: Those who disbelieve almost stab you with their glances when they hear the message, and say, "He is crazy!"
verse.verse_52: But it is no less than a reminder to all the Worlds.
